fields.headline: Bergkamp agrees new Arsenal contract
fields.bodyText: Dennis Bergkamp has ended months of speculation about his future by signing a two-year extension to his contract which will keep him at Arsenal until 2003. "This contract will almost certainly be the last one I ever sign which means I'll be finishing my career here at Arsenal," a delighted Bergkamp told icons.com. "I'm delighted with this because I feel a really strong bond with the club now - I almost consider myself an Arsenal fan." Bergkamp joined Arsenal in 1995 from Internazionale and was a key member of the side that won the Premiership in 1998. But he has spent much of this season overshadowed by Thierry Henry and has only managed two goals in 21 appearances. Last October, Bergkamp complained the club had shown him a "total lack of respect" when negotiations began on a new contract and said he believed he was being frozen out. But today he was delighted to sign a new contract, admitting: "I've stayed for the right reasons - because I love playing for Arsenal," he said on Tuesday. "I've been here for nearly six years now and had some great times. "Some of the sentiments that people have offered me have made me quite emotional. I don't mean to sound melodramatic, but when people say that I'm really important and valued here it's quite touching," he added.
